fields.title: Tutorial ‚Äì Managing entities programmatically
fields.description: Learn how to create and publish entities programmatically in the backend and deliver published entities to the frontend.

children.text: Use the admin client to create and publish Message entities during startup of the backend and use the published client to deliver a random Message entity to the frontend.
Before creating some entities, we use the API call
to check how many messages exist already so we don't create too many messages.
When creating an entity we provide the entity type, auth key, name and
field. We also specify that we want to publish the entity as an atomic operation when creating the entity (if the publishing would fail, e.g. if we forget to provide the required
field, no entity would be created). In
does automatically) ten entities are created and published:
to return a random published message, using a published client. Later on we will add proper authentication, but for now we create a session for an anonymous user for each HTTP request. In
We'll now see a random message in the frontend.
